Update startPayroll and pay interactions with hoursWorked and overtime
commitResults.messageBody:
Update startPayroll command to reset hoursWorked and overtime to 0 immediately after calculating payroll instead of having pay command reset after payment.
Update wordings in infoPanel to make it clear that amount owed is from previous payroll and the displayed hours worked and overtime is the current recorded amount since then.

Previously, the hours worked and overtime is only reset to 0 after payment, resulting in a loophole where new hours worked and overtime could still be added but is not counted towards payroll and is erased when paid.

With this update, this would fit the intended purpose of having the previous payroll being uneditable after being calculated, while still allowing the current hours worked and overtime to be updated and used for the next payroll calculation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix bug with StartPayrollCommand viewing person
commitResults.messageBody: Fix bug where the viewed person after StartPayrollCommand is executed is not updated with the unpaid label.

Update StartPayrollCommand to store persons with calculated payroll in a separate list first, only replacing into the model once all calculations have been successfully done. This prevents data corruption in the case where the StartPayrollCommand operation suddenly terminates halfway.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add defensive coding to pay all command
commitResults.messageBody: Update the pay all command to store persons who are paid in a separate list first, only replacing into the model once all payment have been successfully done. This prevents data corruption in the case where the pay all command operation suddenly terminates halfway.
Edit StartPayrollCommand error message to only show the unpaid employee's name rather than all the details.

commitResults.messageBody:
HeRon is now able to import data from .csv files, provided all fields are present and in the right order required for the Person constructor.
Update build.gradle file to add opencsv as dependency.

Import now only clears the current existing data after confirming specified file exists.
Import now caters for empty tags in the .csv file.
Change the tag seperator from ',' used in the csv file to '/'.

Import can now read .csv files even when the columns are not in the order as specified by the Person constructor.
Add PersonInput class to build CsvToBeanBuilder object which recognises the columns by the header.

Import now provides default values if columns of "Leaves", "Salary", "Hours Worked", "Overtime" and "Remarks" are not present.
Default values for "Leaves", "Salary", "Hours Worked" are 0.
Default value for Remarks is an empty HashSet.

Import functionality for HeRon is now complete.
Add tests to ImportCommand and ImportCommandParser.

Import command takes a string as a path to the .csv file.
Note that the .csv file must have certain headers present in the file for the importing to be succesful.
These headers include: "Name", "Contact Number", "Residential Address", "Email" and "Role". Note that the exact string is required, but they are case insensitive.

commitResults.messageBody:
Fix bug where duplicate names with different cases were allowed.
Fix bug where duplicate names with different number of spaces were allowed.
Update ImportCommandParser use StringBuffer append method instead of String concat method.
Name will now be auto-capitalized before added into HeRon.

ImportCommand threw an InvocationTargetException when there was an error with the headers.
The initial error was not processed properly and thus was not thrown to the user.
This has now been fixed and caught, and user feedback is given.

Add and edit now disallow employees to have same phone or emails.
Add and edit also now disallow employees from having similar names (eg. spacing/casing).
Update test cases to fit new feature requirements.

Import now detects duplicate persons in the import file.
Import now follows the requirements of add/edit, and does not allow for duplicate phone numbers or emails.
If detected, and error message indiciating the rows of the duplicate fields would be returned.

Update import test cases to test for files with Wrong Headers, Duplicate Persons, Duplicate Emails and Duplicate Phone numbers.
Update other test cases as per new add/edit functionality.

commitResults.messageBody: Fix errors for CheckStyleMain

In `add` section:
- Add new example for `Name` field.
- Edit example for `Tag` field from `1st superior`, which is not accepted in HeRon, to `supervisor`.

In `find` section:
- Update description for name queries to indicate that "complete part of names" given should be successful, rather than stating "exact" which may mislead readers that full names must be used during the search.
- Change the first optional parameter `[KEYWORDS]` to `[STATUS]` since "keywords" are also used to describe the input which comes with the respective field tags.
- Update naming of Type 3 Queries from `Condition Based Filter` to `Status Based Filter`
Add missing ` symbol in Type 1 Queries, the example given for name-based queries.

Removed extraneous exception handling.
Update error message formatting for ImportCommand and field classes.
Added additional point that all entries must have the field provided if the field is to be imported.

commitResults.messageTitle: Edit Developer Guide and portfolio file
commitResults.messageBody: Changed tense, formatting, RepoSense link and misc stuff according to comments provided.

Updated the `edit` command to take in other arguments for `Role`, `Leaves`, `Salary`, `HoursWorked`, and made appropriate changes to EditCommand as well as EditCommandParser.
Also updated EditPersonDescriptorBuilder for testing, but apart from that no further tests added related to edit.

Note: Assumes that all the other related classes (`Person`, `AddCommandParser` etc) have been updated as well. I did up my own implementation of everything and it works, but I saw @boonhaii already did it so what to do

Made ammendments to certain test cases to take into account the `Role`, `Leaves`, `Salary` and `HoursWorked` of the Person in both EditCommand and its respective parser.
Changed message constraint and regex for Role to suit with test cases.

Redone implementation, added `CalculatedPay` class and added the new `calculatedPay` attribute to the `Person` class.
Edit Person constructor to take in calculatedPay attribute as well.
The relevant fields in other classes and files have been amended account for the new attribute and constructor.

PayCommand implemented by replacing `personToPay` with `paidPerson`, where `paidPerson` 's `calculatedPay` is 0.

Added a few tests for PayCommand, should add more in future.

Side panel which I have decided to call info panel has been added to the right half of the program. Currently on startup, displays all possible fields of a `Person` of a test dummy person.

Created new InfoPanel class as well as its respective fxml file, added more styles to DarkTheme.css
Added the InfoPanel in the MainWindow.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update info panel to change person dispalyed
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous commit was only displaying a test person, current implementation takes the person at the first index of the list to display on start up.
Commands such as `add`, `edit`, `find` and `pay` will cause the display to change to the person they are referring to.

Note that cases where there might be no contacts in the list has not been taken into account yet.

Added the `ViewCommand` and `ViewCommandParser`, user can view any person at any index in the list
Format: `view INDEX`

Made adjustments to take account case where AddressBook list is empty.
One of the test cases was adjusted weirdly to take into account the implementation of the viewingPerson model, I have made a note there.

Edited the implementation so that it does not update the InfoPanel every single time when a command is executed, and uses the listener structure.
Also added enableAssertions to build.gradle

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix content to display when empty employee list
commitResults.messageBody:
Added an overlay over the InfoPanel which says 'Employee list is empty!' when list is empty obviously.
Happens when clear command or delete is done for all employees.
On deleting an employee, view is set to first person in employee list.
Added another test in StringUtil to check for negative sign, and modified the `isValid` methods in the respective classes.
Added another test in StringUtil to check for negative sign, and modified the `isValid` methods in the respective classes.
Explain what details the overlay has.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update import command to update InfoPanel
commitResults.messageBody: On import, sets viewingPerson to the first person in the importedList to remove the overlay.

Delete command now only updates the InfoPanel if the `personToDelete` is the same as the `viewingPerson` by setting viewingPerson to the first person in the employee list.
Of course, if list is empty, updates display with overlay on the InfoPanel.

commitResults.messageTitle: slight amend to DeleteCommand for UI

commitResults.messageBody:
Note: No change in functionality in this commit, purely implementation.

Previous versions used the in-built java observable classes, which I have experienced to be quite buggy and weird, as it does not consistently update its observers.
To solve this, custom Obserable and Observer classes have been created to be used instead.

Took some of the suggestions into mind, and tried to make use of optional in certain places
Misc: Added text wrapping to result display

List of updates:
ModelClassDiagram
UiClassDiagram
InfoPanelClassDiagram - added
ViewSequenceDiagram - added

Revamped the implementation section for InfoPanel to take into account the observer pattern.
Removed print line from add command as well
boldening some words
